column1: With COVID-19 cases surging it’s important that we all take measures to stay healthy and keep our communities safe this Thanksgiving. The CDC has issued guidance on celebrating the holidays safely this year read more: https://t.co/VUXvswLmzO https://t.co/WH51vcIpP5

COVID-19 continues to threaten the vulnerable Americans living in our nation’s nursing homes including those enduring ongoing outbreaks in long-term care facilities in Santa Cruz and Watsonville. https://t.co/HCtU0HpUEP

The California Department of Public Health has released guidance for safer Halloween and Día de los Muertos celebrations during COVID-19. Keep your family healthy and safe this Fall learn more: https://t.co/0uCvmRMKIx

I wish the President & First Lady a safe & speedy recovery. This is an important reminder that COVID-19 is highly contagious dangerous & can affect anyone. Please continue to follow health safety guidelines & wear a mask practice physical distancing & wash hands frequently.

Proud to join my colleagues to introduce legislation to strengthen federal government disaster assistance to ease the financial burden on state and local governments as they respond to natural crises exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn more: https://t.co/cOdxEYL6ls.

This year getting your flu shot is more important than ever to help conserve health care resources during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.  To learn more and find where you can get vaccinated visit https://t.co/RA1nzz8tXr.

Today @USDA announced its second round of Coronavirus Food Assistance Program funding would expand eligibility to all grape producers. Earlier this month my colleagues & I called on the USDA to make this critical expansion. Read our letter: https://t.co/s2q1uXxOYC

Additional funding has been announced by @USDA for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP).    Starting Monday Sept. 21 to Dec. 11 USDA will accept applications for CFAP from agricultural producers who have been impacted by COVID-19. Learn more at https://t.co/fCNN4WICBl https://t.co/JM0OIiwfrU

Today I joined @RiceNews to discuss the impact of COVID-19 and international trade on our rice industry. I'll continue to advocate for our farmers and farmworkers. Learn more about how CRC is keeping employees safe & our food supply chain on track here:  https://t.co/fx3MpcEjMb

Productive discussion with the Monterey and Santa Cruz Medical Societies on their challenges during the pandemic.  I’ll continue my work to ensure future COVID relief packages give our health care providers the tools they need to keep the Central Coast healthy and safe. https://t.co/YrXhTykioc

Joined my @WaysMeansCmte colleagues for a hearing on the importance of additional COVID-19 relief and heard @tomcolicchio's perspective on how hunger is affecting our communities.  I discussed the need for the Senate to pass the Heroes Act to provide immediate relief. https://t.co/WsQVpx2Emr

Great to be w/ @RodneyDavis & former @USDA Sec. @DanRGlickman to discuss challenges facing our agricultural communities. I’ll continue my work on @HouseAgDems to ensure Central Coast farmers & farmworkers have the support they need to get to the other side of COVID-19. https://t.co/wsLiiJFkPE

Yesterday I heard from @MCOE_Now & @sccounty Office of Education trustees on the challenges they face heading into the school year. As we face wildfires & COVID-19 in our communities we must ensure that schools have the tools necessary to keep students & faculty safe & healthy. https://t.co/q6RzGS5pcK

I joined @RepGilCisneros and @RepAdamSchiff in leading the CA delegation in urging USDA Secretary Perdue to extend food program flexibilities that feed seniors during the COVID-19 pandemic. USDA must renew these so that our most vulnerable seniors safely can be safely served. https://t.co/sMgzouVLSH

To get a complete and accurate census we need sufficient funding. That's why @repJayapal asked me to join her in requesting that House and Senate leadership ensure the next COVID-19 relief package extends Census reporting deadlines and allocates $400million in emergency funding. https://t.co/tp524qjNzg

Wildfires COVID19 and short deadlines are already making it hard to ensure we have a complete #2020Census. I am proud to join @SenFeinstein @RepZoeLofgren and @repjimmygomez in asking @uscensusbureau how they’ll ensure everyone is counted during these challenging circumstances. https://t.co/bESI4tR43F
More than 130 specialty crops are eligible for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. @USDA is accepting applications through September 11. You can learn more at https://t.co/mYmDArBHRZ.
An illuminating look at how we on the Central Coast are confronting climate change conflagrations and COVID-19.  https://t.co/X9xLZOMf0W

With just over 2 months left until Election Day our nation is facing a severe shortage of poll workers due to COVID-19. Interested in helping our election infrastructure by participating in this critical role? Learn more and sign up here: https://t.co/J2PTNMeMxC

Today I led my California colleagues in sending a bipartisan letter to VP Pence in his capacity as head of the White House Coronavirus Task Force requesting N-95 masks for our farmers and farmworkers impacted by extreme heat and wildfire smoke.   https://t.co/JivgqMsd7k

Enjoyed meeting with Second Harvest of Santa Cruz Food Bank to hear about their work to serve the Central Coast and how COVID-19 has affected operations. As a Member of the Ag Committee I will continue to advocate for and secure effective resources for food assistance programs. https://t.co/yQSPm2zXEc

This is unacceptable and it's been going on for too long. I continue to call on the President to implement a national testing strategy and establish of a nationwide standard for all COVID-19 diagnostic test results to be returned in a timely manner. https://t.co/l6KQQLo9n1

Rent is due & many families don't know how they're going to make payments amid #COVID19. We must extend the eviction moratorium & provide urgently needed rent relief.  The #HeroesAct includes: ✅emergency rental assistance ✅extension of the eviction & foreclosure moratoriums

Gun sales have spiked 136% since the start of the pandemic.  FBI background checks are being delayed & some are never completed. @SenFeinstein & I are fighting to include our bill to strengthen the background checks system in the next COVID-19 package. https://t.co/y2haAtqiZo

We must prioritize affordable housing in the next COVID-19 relief package.  I joined 100+ members in urging for enhancements to the Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (Housing Credit) be included in the next COVID-19 bill to support affordable housing production & address disruptions. https://t.co/CfmCOqUyME

Today I participated in a roundtable with @WaysMeansCmte to hear from unemployed workers and share the stories of constituents who lost their jobs through no fault of their own because of #COVID19. We must continue to provide assistance to families & workers who need it most. https://t.co/6idtCuSHcl

COVID-19 has caused temporary and permanent closures of child care providers and exacerbated the shortage of quality affordable child care for working families.  Today we're voting on the #ChildCareIsEssential Act to  support providers to safely reopen and operate. https://t.co/pvxayDMBWc

I have also called on the White House Coronavirus Task Force to immediately address the safety needs of American firefighters and the communities they serve as the COVID-19 pandemic persists and the 2020 wildfire season progresses. https://t.co/QOXo4e0kVs

Today I called the @forestservice Chief Vicki Christiansen to discuss staffing needs in the Los Padres National Forest along with USFS activities in response to COVID-19 and the 2020 wildfire year. https://t.co/gZnZJulKMG

Today we on the @WaysMeansCmte Trade Subcommittee held a virtual hearing on the effects and long-term impacts of COVID-19 on supply chains. I spoke about the critical need for a national testing strategy and how we must bolster supply chains to increase COVID-19 testing.  Watch: https://t.co/CpIzWqBPEj

Happening Now: We on the @WaysMeansCmte Trade Subcommittee are holding a hearing on the effects of COVID-19 on supply chains and the long-term challenges facing American manufacturing and economic growth. We remain focused on making our economy work for every American. https://t.co/jtoW7fUv8I

I'm calling on House leadership to ensure that we provide our educators with the resources they need to fully support students with disabilities & fulfill the promise of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/oKUsYBFp7T

Testing testing testing! Until there is a vaccine the best weapon we can use in our fight against COVID-19 is more accessible & accurate testing. I've introduced legislation to require the President fully mobilize the Defense Production Act for testing supplies & distribution. https://t.co/scHYURbwOX

Right now the best weapon we can use in our fight against the coronavirus is more accessible & accurate testing. I continue to pressure the President to fully mobilize the DPA to direct production procurement & distribution of supplies to increase testing https://t.co/uJfNL6zN5O

At the start of this pandemic I told the President we need a national strategy for testing.  Now I’ve introduced legislation to require he fully invoke the Defense Production Act for testing supplies. We need to be able to see #COVID19 in order to defeat it. https://t.co/sLn8i5K28b

I continue to push for the passage of my legislation the COVID-19 Testing Procurement Act to require the President to fully mobilize the Defense Production Act (DPA) for the emergency production procurement and distribution of testing supplies for COVID-19. https://t.co/Bk5XE8ZNsS

We need to be able to see this disease in order to fight it. The administration must release a national strategy for testing.  I introduced the COVID-19 Testing Procurement Act to require the President to fully mobilize the Defense Production Act for testing supplies. https://t.co/201uCAe8RB
I'll be on KZSC 88.1FM at 8:30am to talk about the need to increase COVID-19 testing PPP Loans the Heroes Act and more. Tune in: https://t.co/fwi6VD4LxU

I continue to push for the passage of my legislation the COVID-19 Testing Procurement Act to require the President to fully mobilize the Defense Production Act (DPA) for the emergency production procurement and distribution of testing supplies for COVID-19.

Happening Now: We're holding a hearing on IT Modernization to respond to #COVID19 & plan for the future. I'll be talking about the importance of improving technology delivery systems so recipients of CalFresh & nutrition assistance programs can efficiently use their benefits https://t.co/h60Kur9zyT

Today is the deadline to apply for pandemic food benefits for children! Students who receive free or reduced price meals are eligible for up to $365 for groceries while schools are closed due to #COVID19.  Apply at https://t.co/IYKfI8dmHJ

Former Fed Chair Bernanke hits the nail on the head. I’m fighting to include more aid to state and local governments in the next COVID-19 relief package.  This funding will save jobs and preserve services critical to fighting this virus and supporting our economic recovery. https://t.co/3eTkv73nxM

This is unacceptable and it doesn’t need to be this way. I introduced the COVID-19 Testing Procurement Act to require the President to fully mobilize the DPA for the emergency production procurement and distribution of testing supplies for COVID-19. https://t.co/eYECOpKOlO

From the beginning I've said the lack of testing is the original sin of this pandemic & called for more testing capabilities and a national testing strategy.I introduced the COVID-19 Testing Procurement Act for emergency production procurement & distribution of testing supplies https://t.co/WidKFbuWdB

Spoke with the Central Coast Early Education Advocacy Network about the needs of young children families caregivers and educators during COVID19 & beyond. I worked to secure aid for Head Start &providers in the CARES Act and will keep fighting for our nation’s childcare system https://t.co/HIeyJeA2J3
If we’re going to beat #COVID19 we need to know more about it. That’s why federal investments in research & development are more important than ever. https://t.co/lQADYVEuop

We on the Budget Committee are holding a virtual hearing on the importance of science and the positive impacts of federal investments in R&D. As our nation grapples with #COVID19 & economic uncertainty these investments accelerate innovation & job growth. https://t.co/8N1kCeYmXv

US pledges to withdraw from @WHO in the middle of a bruising pandemic & China leans into it by pledging $2billion to fight #COVID19 Now is no time to disengage from our responsibilities as a world leader &create a vacuum that other governments without our values will happily fill https://t.co/or3bsgE66w
Why wear a mask? Because asymptomatic people can transmit COVID-19 to others. Cover smart. Do your part. Slow the spread. Watch: https://t.co/W23hqX2VIO

COVID-19 forced many colleges to remote-learning only.  That shouldn't jeopardize education for international students who are legally allowed to study here.  Trump admin's decision to not issue visas for those students is harsh heedless and will hurt our nation’s workforce. https://t.co/yomM2Qa4jQ

Families across the Central Coast are struggling to afford housing as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic.  This week we in the House passed the Emergency Housing Protections and Relief Act to help renters & homeowners. The Senate must act & pass this bill. https://t.co/wgMtWL0R0H

This year on top of managing higher-than-normal fire potential across the countryour firefighters face a completely new set of challenges due to COVID19. The Coronavirus Task Force must help firefighters so they can do their jobs &protect our communities https://t.co/QOXo4e0kVs

I am proud to have helped the Bates secure their VA pension. I remain committed to serving all constituents whether it be related to COVID-19 or veterans services immigration or social security. My offices are open 9am-5pm Monday-Saturday to serve you. https://t.co/WKP3zV084r

As we continue to battle the COVID-19 pandemic affordable health care is more important than ever. Today I'll be voting for the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Enhancement Act to lower drug prices lower premiums expand coverage and fight inequity in health care. https://t.co/qOdHUIuiaK

I joined the @WaysMeansCmte Health Subcommittee to discuss the COVID-19 crisis in nursing homes and how we can improve conditions for residents and staff. I asked how we can better incentivize staffing increase testing and reduce patient harm. Watch: https://t.co/7LzJshexSJ https://t.co/jSCP1sWhdd

The Budget Committee held a hearing on how COVID-19 is exacerbating the health & wealth inequities in our country. I asked how we can reduce these disparities for the Latinx community and farmworkers on the Central Coast. Watch: https://t.co/TPaMdSJuis https://t.co/wpAIN9FhJT

Participated in the Big Sur Multi Agency Advisory Council meeting with community leaders. I provided a Congressional update including my work to provide resources and relief related to COVID-19 the Justice in Policing Act that we will be voting on next week and USFS resourcing https://t.co/I2fq9djKRi

We on @WaysMeansCmte held a hearing today on how we can provide much needed tax relief to support workers and families during the COVID-19 pandemic and create a more equitable economy in the future. I asked the experts about affordable housing. Watch: https://t.co/ZEIeIefMMa https://t.co/VmRMmihJS4

We on the Central Coast have long known that farmworkers are essential. Now others see how vulnerable they are during this pandemic. I led 72 of my colleagues in calling on House leadership to fund protections for farmworkers & their children in the next COVID-19 response package https://t.co/VdmXC4Yo4c

The U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) reopened the Economic Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL) and EIDL Advance program portal to all eligible applicants experiencing economic impacts due to COVID-19. Apply here: https://t.co/Xe42O8qLRI

I introduced the Safe Reopening Tax Credit to provide businesses and nonprofits a tax credit for expenses related to preventing the spread of COVID-19 as they reopen for customers and visitors. https://t.co/g0YXNFePer
Why wear a mask? Because asymptomatic people can transmit #COVID19 to others.  Cover smart. Do your part. Slow the spread. https://t.co/obSiud5z0H

Today I introduced the Safe Reopening Tax Credit Act legislation to provide businesses and nonprofits a tax credit for expenses related to preventing the spread of COVID-19 as they reopen for customers and visitors. https://t.co/dhZTA10e9y

As businesses stores and attractions reopen they are taking necessary steps to keep customers & employees safe. I'm introducing the Safe Reopening Tax Credit Act to allow small businesses to offset expenses related to preventing the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/xddUOkHJZZ

I'll be on KZSC at 8:15am today to talk about the Justice in Policing Act of which I am an original cosponsor and continued federal response to the COVID-19 public health and economic crisis.  Listen live: https://t.co/7yf2avaW8Y

More federal funding from the CARES Act is being delivered to the Central Coast to support homeless Americans and individuals at risk of becoming homeless because of hardships such as job loss wage reduction or illness due to COVID-19. https://t.co/JjGIyGE9Gb
I'll be on La Buena KRAY 103.5 FM today at 11:10am to discuss resources for Latino community members during the #COVID19 pandemic. Tune in https://t.co/RJN3F6qcD7

There has been a surge in gun sales during the COVID-19 pandemic. The recent spike in gun sales means more background checks need to be completed by an already overburdened system and may not be completed in the allotted 88 days. 4/5 https://t.co/rPAylhBTYB

Our nation is fighting an unprecedented economic downturn because of #COVID19. We on the @HouseBudgetDems are holding a virtual hearing on addressing the immediate needs of our communities and long-term economic recovery. https://t.co/Vu2mEAHUW3

It was a pleasure joining LULAC this morning in Hollister to congratulate our local graduates at a socially-distant ceremony. These are challenging times for multiple reasons. This generation will help rebuild our country. https://t.co/swvcLIzWfr

This crisis has shown what we have always known on the Central Coast: our farmworkers are not only valuable integral parts of our communities they are vulnerable. The next COVID19 relief package must include funding dedicated to combating spread of the virus among farm workers. https://t.co/q526i5aFvW

I am pleased that National Guard members currently  deployed to support COVID-19 response can continue their mission.  Through our pressure & introducing my National Guard COVID-19 Earned Benefits Guarantee Act they can receive federal retirement & education benefits they earned https://t.co/2Wr6JYa5vM

Today we in the House observed a moment of silence in memory of the more than 100000 Americans who have lost their lives to COVID-19.   May we honor them by continuing to work to keep each other safe. We will get through this together. https://t.co/uPQEjkMyXQ

100000 lives have now been lost to COVID-19. They were our friends our loved ones our children and grandparents. This did not have to happen. Let us honor their memories by continuing to work to keep each other safe. We will get through this together. https://t.co/BlWQBXPaHZ

Yesterday we on the @WaysMeansCmte held a hearing on the disproportionate impact of COVID-19 on communities of color.  I'm highlighted the need for protections for farmworkers on the Central Coast. Watch here: https://t.co/hM30rXsM0g

Happening now: we on the @WaysMeansCmte are holding a hearing on the disproportionate impact of COVID-19 on communities of color.   I'm speaking with experts about food security and protections for farmworkers. https://t.co/S0xw51diCo

Happening at 9amPDT: We on @WaysMeansCmte are holding a hearing on the disproportionate impact of COVID-19 on communities of color.   This is the first virtual hearing in the history of the U.S. House of Reps. We will continue to work for our communities. https://t.co/0ckTcNlXzm

Starting TODAY USDA will be accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) from agricultural producers who have been impacted by COVID-19. Forms information on eligibility and a CFAP payment calculator can be found at https://t.co/fCNN4WICBl

I've introduced bipartisan legislation with @RepSherrill & @RepPeteKing to ensure the men & women of the National Guard serving on the frontlines of the COVID-19 response can earn all of their deserved benefits as they continue to defend our communities. https://t.co/mQ3QZUjwd1

Thread: According to recent reporting the Administration is considering cutting off most National Guard COVID-19 activations one day short of the threshold required for certain retirement and educational benefits.  1/3 https://t.co/Lxf9NHSZ7R

This is unacceptable.  We must right this wrong.  I’ll be introducing legislation this week to ensure the brave servicemembers deployed to the frontlines of the COVID-19 response are provided the benefits they so rightly deserve. https://t.co/20OLpaN7kG

Happening Now: I'm speaking with @NAMICommunicate Monterey County for a live webinar as part of my #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth series to talk about the impact COVID-19 is having on mental health as well as local & federal resources. Watch: https://t.co/4emF9JIQWK

Facebook Live Today at 3pmPDT: Continuing my #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth series. Join me & @NAMICommunicate Monterey County for a live webinar today to talk about the impact COVID-19 is having on mental health as well as local & federal resources. Watch: https://t.co/4emF9K0slk

I spoke with @mitchellreports about legislation I co-introduced to create a Health Force and a Resiliency Force to help respond to and combat the COVID-19 pandemic. The Health Force would recruit train and employ Americans to expand our public health workforce in our communities https://t.co/wxXVMSpVJK

Santa Cruz County leaders are urging essential workers to get COVID-19 swab tests at a new site in Watsonville.   The test site is at Ramsay Park in Watsonville is open by appointment Wednesday through Sunday.   https://t.co/MNd1bdbES1
San Benito County announces the general public can now sign up for COVID-19 testing at the Veterans Memorial Building in Hollister. Find out how here: https://t.co/3qT69P3SFy

Residents & workers at nursing homes are particularly susceptible to #COVID19.Nurses & staff need more support to properly care for vulnerable residents. I introduced a bill to fund strike teams to protect our loved ones who live & work in those facilities https://t.co/qnifkNkfdp

In response to the COVID-19 outbreak California is providing one-time state-funded disaster relief assistance to undocumented adults who are ineligible for other forms of assistance because of their immigration status. https://t.co/V8qYDmYGoM

I co-introduced the Health Force and Resilience Force Act to recruit train and employ Americans to conduct testing contact tracing and eventual vaccine administration to combat COVID-19 and strengthen America’s longer-term public health response.  Read more here: https://t.co/gdDe33u0Gt

In March a U.S. district judge ruled that this Administration’s proposed changes to the work requirements for SNAP could not take place given the economic implications of the COVID-19 pandemic. The situation for many individuals has only become worse since then. 1/3 https://t.co/Vc3JgZefnf

2020 Congressional Art Competition: Each year my office holds an art competition for Central Coast students. This year we are holding it virtually due to #COVID19.   Submissions are due TOMORROW May 13.  Please visit my website for more information: https://t.co/UtBfdTSz6t

Great to speak with Mark from @GilroyChamber about federal resources for businesses during this #COVID19 pandemic and my work to help business owners & families across our community. Please don’t hesitate to reach out to my office with questions or visit https://t.co/23ZP8peRhE https://t.co/z3qaOMHbKh

Without a vaccine the best weapon we can use in our fight against #COVID19 is more testing and contact tracing. @RepJasonCrow @RepUnderwood & I are introducing a bill to create a Health Force that would hire & train Americans to conduct testing & tracing https://t.co/05bhTr721P

The President could help to fix this if he fully mobilized the DPA to direct production procurement and distribution of supplies to increase testing for COVID-19.  https://t.co/GaX4seD57p https://t.co/e1I9P1UZlO

Without a vaccine the best weapon we can use in our fight against the coronavirus is more accessible & accurate testing. I continue to call on the President to fully mobilize the DPA to direct production procurement and distribution of supplies to increase testing for COVID-19 https://t.co/5BWwg3Jlbu

Looking forward to hosting a live webinar with the Veterans Transition Center (VTC) today at 10amPDT. We will be talking about the impact COVID-19 is having on veterans and sharing mental health resources. Watch here: #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth  https://t.co/cpmmc2RKJh
Join me at 2:30pmPDT for a live webinar with @NAMIAdvocacy Monterey Country to talk the impact COVID-19 is having on mental health and local resources. Watch here: https://t.co/L4wl7BqTpe

We need a Health Force to conduct testing and contact tracing for COVID-19. We can help provide a dedicated workforce to perform these vital tasks and ultimately help us return to something approaching a normal life.  https://t.co/05bhTr721P

Firefighters put themselves at risk every day to keep our community members on the Central Coast safe and that hasn't changed during this trying time. I'm grateful to the men and women on the frontlines of COVID-19 helping to keep us safe & healthy. #InternationalFirefightersDay https://t.co/4wOC9b0T3X

Until a COVID-19 vaccine or viable treatment strategy is developed ongoing testing & contact tracing is necessary to contain the epidemic & reopen the economy. I’ll be on @MSNBC at 11:15am today to talk about my legislation to increase #COVID19 testing and contact tracing https://t.co/8iBE2xZoW8

Today at 11:30amPDT I'll be holding a webinar with the Monterey County YWCA to discuss the impact that COVID-19 is having domestic violence and resources for community members. Watch live here: https://t.co/4DrnOnvTjS

Thousands of meatpacking workers have been infected with COVID-19.  That’s another example of the difficult work and at times hazardous working conditions without proper protections endured by some in our critical agriculture workforce. (1/2) https://t.co/bPq65pM3OY

DACA recipients are on the front lines of the fight against #COVID19 in our hospitals grocery stores fields and supply chains. Despite the uncertainty they’re still giving back to the only country many of them have ever called home. #HomeIsHere https://t.co/SnXDllP343
